text: hi everyone anthony fantano here
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a quick little review of the
new mazzy star album seasons of your day
these guys are a west coast rock band i
would consider listening to them if you
think of yourself as a big fan
of dream pop and there may be
considering how many reverb laden and
and buzzy guitar driven pop rock bands
there are out there these days also you
have to kind of consider the success of
bands like beach house
as well with the potential of people
liking mazzy's star today because beach
house's earliest stuff was incredibly
indebted to what mazzy starr's music was
now this is mazzy star's first album in
17 years and in the meantime between
these album releases key members hope
sandoval
and david roback were working on other
musical projects however i would hardly
call their time away from putting out
mazzy star records prolific now a lot
like the last my bloody valentine record
some of you may already know that i dug
that album uh this mazzy star album
consists of material that was recorded
between this huge hiatus so it should be
no surprise that on this record mazzy
star sounds exactly like how you
remember them the instrumentation on
these songs has tons of space they're
played at a slow pace the melodies are
shy the percussion is sparse
hope sandoval's vocals still sound as
fantastic as they ever have they still
have their main characteristics in that
they feel a little aged dusty a lot of
people would say smokey but
simultaneously they are very light
breezy and and youthful very young the
guitars of course are slow paced as well
splashed with reverb the acoustic
guitars yes but especially the electric
guitars both of which have a slight
country twang
to them too sonically mazzy star has not
changed a bit and it's kind of weird
because i can't help but think of of
this band as well because they just came
out with their first album in 17 years
too
the uk melodic death metal band carcass
both bands have returned with new
records that are literally so close in
sound to their most celebrated stuff you
really kind of have to squint to see the
difference both are albums that i like
but neither are albums that i really
feel like returning to at the end of the
day honestly there are tracks on this
new album of of mazzy stars like spoon
and flying low that that to me are
showing just how
little direction the songwriting on this
album can have at points to me these
tracks just meander they don't really
stay engaging from beginning to end and
it's not like mazzy star hasn't written
tracks that are this long before and
there are other tracks on here that
though they may be shorter
they feel similarly
stagnant in in how the songs progress
like california or does someone have
your baby now which is a track that to
me exchanges the idea of putting
together a direct song for this really
incessant twangy slide acoustic guitar
that just doesn't stay that interesting
for the duration of the track there are
other songs on here that instrumentally
i think are a little more fleshed out
something i could sink my teeth into a
little bit more and also have a somewhat
seductive country style to them songs
like i've gotta stop and lay myself down
both of which yes our country but have a
very kind of painful emotion coming from
the melodies and the lyrics and are
really so good that it's worth checking
out the album just for these songs to
yes enjoy these songs themselves but
even see if the entire album appeals to
you a little bit more than it did me and
there are other spots to me where the
instrumentation stands out like the very
cutesy keyboards toward the end of the
song sparrow which i thought were very
pretty and then there is the track
common burn which i think to a very very
slight degree
hopes vocals come off a little more
bright a little
more bold than they are on other tracks
here especially the softer sort of more
dead pan vocals where i am getting a bit
of a velvet underground influence which
of course in mazzy star's older stuff
it's it's always been there again it's a
pretty good album it sounds likeable and
above all it's it's precious
but is it an album that i feel like i
put above anything mazzystar has done in
the past not particularly if you've
given this lp a listen what did you
think of it did you love it hate it why
what do you think i should review next
that's it
thank you for watching anthony fantano
mazzy star
forever
[Music]
you
